job_title: Anonymous/Employee in Murrells Inlet, SC
pros: Great team and family feeling. Best employer I have ever worked for.

job_title: OR Technician in Murrells Inlt, SC
pros: The patients and amazing co-workers who are willing to share their years experience.
cons: The facility is poorly ran from the top all the way to middle management. The lack of consistent communication channels shows with employees being misinformed consistently. Also there seem to be regular issues with interdepartmental communication. The facility needs a complete face lift, your direct care providers are what make up your mission, vision, and purpose don’t forget that. Listen to their recommendations when they say management doesn’t advocate for them or certain policies are counterintuitive. These are not only your greatest asset but your greatest resource. You can’t run your “non-profit” without them.

review_title: Wouldn't Send My Worst Enemy to Work Here
job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Georgetown, SC
pros: Colleagues are nice. So are the nurses and doctors.
cons:
HR is only there to protect management and their bad decisions. No foresight from management. Everything falls on employees. No accountability for leaders. They make it seem like a good company but if you ever make a mistake or make the wrong person irate, they will fry you. They can & will find any reason to fire you if they want to. Turnover is very high because of this. Pharmacy managers do not listen and instead make you feel like you have done wrong when you have not. I wouldn't send my worst enemy to work at this company.

They promise employees first shot at new jobs but nobody ever moves horizontally. Management prevents that at all cost. If they find out you want to move to a different department, you will be fired within a month.

review_title: Management issues and lack of communication
job_title: Senior Technical Analyst in Georgetown, SC
pros: The hospital staff is fantastic and cares about the quality of care of our patients.  There is fantastic community outreach and the physicians truly fight for patient safety/rights, while dealing with an increasingly difficult corporate structure.
cons:
C-Suite lives in a silo and is primarily concerned with market share and expanding with reducing staffing and support.  Benefits are also decreasing each year.

Deteriorating management conditions make working in Information Systems unstable at best.  Long term lack of a CIO and the changing of management several times coupled with layoffs and consultants make teams conflict.  The structure of the department’s org chart is dated and lacks accountability and communication.  Job security appears to not exist.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Murrells Inlet, SC
pros: Slow paced work environment, nothing ground-breaking happening here so the stress levels aren’t too intense, very easy to get to know everyone within the hospital system. Compared to the other local hospital systems in the area, tidelands is the best from an employee’s perspective.
cons: Nepotism Nepotism Nepotism - there are some ridiculously inappropriate managers and directors who continue to advance their careers here simply because of who they are friends with in the system. It really does make for a dangerous work environment at times. The good ole boy system is alive and thriving at tidelands - if that works for you then this is a good place to find a job

review_title: One of the largest, stable employers in the area.

review_title: Just keep looking-Administration/Management doesn't care about nurses!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Georgetown, SC
pros: When I first started here over 10 years ago it was a total family atmosphere and everyone was extremely close. Pay is fair market for the area. The benefits are good but have been copays are creeping up slowly over the years! Have a good wellness program. Will never have a problem getting your hours, because we are always short staffed somewhere thanks to flex pool being eliminated. No worry of company going under since they are using all there money to buy new building instead of rewarding staff.
cons: Teamwork is out the window. They required nurses to go get their BSN degrees without giving any increase in salary for it and then told them it wasn't required after some started school.  Administration doesn't spend enough time evaluating why employees are leaving (why certain floors are having mass exits). It's like they don't care to retain experience over new grads that put their patients lives in jeopardy until there happens to be a centennial event occur.  Too Much To List, mainly all about admin./management being so greedy that they deprive the units and people actually rendering customer service the stuff they need. Thought they would reward staff by making hard cover books (that probably cost a fortune and everyone threw away or left laying around when they could have added money to gift cards).

review_title: Probably one of the best places to work in the Grand Strand

job_title: Registered Nurse in Murrells Inlet, SC
